page.title: 14Schools
page.content: {Penshurst C.E. Primary School}is a small village school founded in 1846 and extended in 1966. It has 3 classrooms, one for the 20 infants, one for the 28 juniors and and one for activities. It has a stained glass window in memory of Rosamund Dubuisson the school manager from 1935-1975. There is a field with an adventure playground behind the school, a sandpit, a swimming pool and in front a playground. {Speldhurst C.E. Primary School}was built in 1859. There are 66 children split into 3 classes. They have a field and a playground and a pond with a conservation area. The school house is used for offices, a T.V. room and the kiln room.
